001package net.tvburger.jdl.linear.optimizer;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.JavaNumberTypeSupport;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.linalg.TypedVector;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.linalg.Vector;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.linear.LinearBasisFunctionModel;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.optimizer.GradientDescentModelDecomposer;
008
009import java.util.stream.Stream;
010
011public class LinearBasisFunctionModelDecomposer<N extends Number> implements GradientDescentModelDecomposer<LinearBasisFunctionModel<N>, N> {
012
013    @Override
014    public Stream<GradientDecomposition<N>> calculateDecompositionGradients(LinearBasisFunctionModel<N> model, Vector<N> objectiveGradients, N[] inputs) {
015        if (objectiveGradients.getDimensions() != 1) {
016            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Objective gradients must have exactly one dimension");
017        }
018        JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport = model.getCurrentNumberType();
019        N[] features = model.getFeatureExtractor().extractFeatures(inputs[0]);
020        N[] inputGradients = typeSupport.createArray(features.length + 1);
021        inputGradients[0] = objectiveGradients.get(1);
022        for (int i = 0; i < features.length; i++) {
023            inputGradients[i + 1] = typeSupport.multiply(objectiveGradients.get(1), features[i]);
024        }
025        Vector<N> inputGradientsVector = new TypedVector<>(inputGradients, true, typeSupport);
026        return Stream.of(new GradientDecomposition<>(model, inputGradientsVector));
027    }
028
029}
